title: Greek Prime Minister announces May elections after train disaster
description: The train disaster sparked weeks of angry and occasionally violent protests, and struck a massive blow to Prime Minister Kyriakos Mitsotakis and his government ahead of the elections.

title: Ugandan lawmakers pass sweeping anti-LGBTQ legislation
description: Offenders could face life imprisonment or even the death penalty for 'aggravated' offences.

title: Wills Reed, New York Knicks legend, dies at 80
description: The Knicks icon, who led the organization to two NBA championships in the 1970s, died on Tuesday.

title: IMF grants Ukraine $15.6 billion loan to support 'post-war reconstruction'
description: The four-year plan, which is subject to approval from the IMF board, would support Ukraine's 'ongoing gradual economic recovery.'

title: France's Assemblée Nationale adopts 'nuclear acceleration' bill on first reading
description: In the bill, which aims to ease the construction of new reactors in the country, the reform on nuclear safety was the only section rejected by the opposition.

title: Nuclear power: 'Newcleo is on its way to becoming Europe's best-funded start-up'
description: The company is to launch of a €1 billion capital increase as it aims to demonstrate it can secure and complete a full nuclear cycle in machines that no longer resemble technological cathedrals but simple boilers, writes Philippe Escande in his column.

title: In Brittany, an 'abandoned' town fumes at Macron's pension reform
description: The government's reform has crystallized anger felt in the town of Guingamp. Threatened by the closure of public services, residents in the rural area feel 'abandoned', causing an unprecedented surge in the far-right vote.

title: Partygate: Boris Johnson denies intentionally misleading British MPs
description: In a newly released dossier, Johnson explains why he believed 10 Downing Street press office Christmas drinks event, with food and presents, was not a 'party.'

title: France deems Israel minister's 'no Palestinians' comments 'irresponsible'
description: Israeli Finance Minister Bezalel Smotrich said in Paris on Sunday there were 'no Palestinians because there isn't a Palestinian people.'

title: EU alarmed by risk of Tunisian 'economic and social collapse'
description: EU foreign ministers fear the prospect of another migration crisis if the Tunisian economy fails.

title: Fears of petrol shortages resurface as French refineries strike against pension reform
description: In the southeast of France, queues at filling stations have been getting longer since Saturday, as energy workers continue to fiercely oppose the French government's pension reform.

title: Swiss financial sector in confidence crisis following UBS takeover of Credit Suisse
description: The deal struck on Sunday leaves Switzerland with one major bank, down from three in 1997.

title: Deeply divided Les Républicains are experiencing a serious internal crisis
description: On Monday, one-third of the right-wing group in the Assemblée Nationale voted in favor of the motion of no confidence against the government. While the exclusion of these 19 rebels is not on the agenda, some of their colleagues want sanctions.

title: Japanese PM visits Kyiv to 'show solidarity and support'
description: Fumio Kishida's trip to Ukraine comes as Chinese President Xi Jinping arrives in neighboring Russia. The focus of both meetings is Moscow's invasion of Ukraine.

title: Freed Sahel hostage arrives home in France to emotional welcome
description: French journalist Olivier Dubois returned after nearly two years of capture, along with Jeffery Woodkek, a 61-year US aid worker who was seized in southern Niger in 2016.

title: China's Xi throws support behind Putin during Russia visit
description: The Chinese president, who says he is 'sure' that Russians will rally behind Vladimir Putin during the country's 2024 elections, is multiplying his gestures of support towards his main ally while spiting the United States.

title: 2024 Paris Olympics organizers looking for 45,000 volunteers
description: They want the group of volunteers to include at least 3,000 people with disabilities, in line with Paris' drive to stage an event that is open to everyone

title: 'Global banks are subject to much tighter regulation than in 2008. But panic has returned'
description: After the great financial crisis in 2008, new rules were supposed to ensure that this phenomenon would not happen again. We will soon know if these rules are effective, observes columnist Eric Albert.

title: Arab outcry after Israeli minister Smotrich's anti-Palestinian rant in Paris
description: The Palestinian Authority, Jordan and Egypt condemned remarks by the finance minister, who described the Palestinian people as an 'invention.' The French authorities have not reacted.

title: French government narrowly survives no-confidence vote, but looks more isolated than ever
description: After the pension reform was passed without a vote in the Assemblée Nationale, the opposition fell nine votes short of toppling the government.

title: Macron considers next steps after pensions battle
description: While Prime Minister Elisabeth Borne saved her skin on Monday, the French government looks more isolated than ever. President Emmanuel Macron will address the nation on Wednesday.

title: The rising threat of French organized crime, a neglected reality
description: Justice Minister Eric Dupond-Moretti praises the sale of seized criminal assets. It is a useful action, but it cannot be the sole strategy in public policy against organized crime.

title: 'In the struggle over pension reform, Macron is as much the driving force behind a high-risk political reconfiguration as its victim'
description: 'Le Monde' columnist Françoise Fressoz highlights the devastating effects of the French government's use of Article 49.3 of the Constitution to force through the pension reform bill, resulting in an isolated government and a weakened democracy.

title: French pension reform: What happens next? Macron speaks and more strikes
description: Opponents to the reform are still hoping they can convince the president not to sign the bill into law, while the government looks for a way to calm spirits.

title: 'It's huge for me to be here': How the last French hostage in West Africa was freed
description: Journalist Olivier Dubois was freed on Monday, March 20 after two years as a hostage of an Al-Qaeda affiliate in Mali. He will return to France on Tuesday.

title: Kylian Mbappé named captain of French national team
description: The 24-year-old will take the armband after goalkeeper Hugo Lloris, who was captain for  over a decade, retired from international duty.

title: IPCC report: Approval session held up by multiple blockages and tensions
description: Only about 30 of the 150 countries represented stayed until the end of the session to adopt the report and its summary.

title: 'Paris, stand up, rise up': Tensions high after pension reform adopted
description: There were gatherings in a number of French cities on Monday evening after the rejection of two motions of no confidence. In the capital, there were clashes between young demonstrators and police, with at least 243 people arrested.

title: UK's largest police force needs 'complete overhaul,' says new report
description: The government report, which was commissioned after a London women's murder by a Metropolitan police officer, highlights homophobia, bullying and predatory behavior.

title: Firms fuel inflation by increasing their profit margins
description: Although less not as strong in France than elsewhere, firms added to inflation in 2022, particularly in the final quarter.

title: Anger on the streets of France as pension reform is adopted
description: Protests were held across the country after Macron's government survived a no-confidence vote.

title: Paris 2024 Olympics: why automated video surveillance is a contentious issue
description: Passed by senators in January, the bill on the Olympic Games is being debated from Monday in the Assemblée Nationale.

title: Biden issues first veto, taking on new Republican House
description: The veto represents a more confrontational approach as the President contends with a House intent on undoing his legacy.
